name: “Poor People Invest in Survival, Rich People Set the Rate” OR "Tricks the Rich Do to Get the Poor to Pay More"
description: "This is the mindset of rich people versus poor people, a rich designer vs. a poor designer... entrepreneurism 101..." "Entrepreneurship is not for everybody, and it's okay. I’m not saying one is superior to the other." (Assuming that blue collar work and white collar work wages have kept up with inflation) He mentions that all work is honorable, but isn’t the arrangement of some work less alienating than others? How else can we read between the lines of Chris Do’s “neutral" stance?
